intro: Casearia bahamensis, commonly known as the Bahamian casearia, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean islands. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant features small, opposite leaves with a slightly rough texture and produces clusters of small, white to yellowish flowers. Its fruit is a small, three-lobed capsule that contains several seeds. Casearia bahamensis is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy soils and salt spray.
